snippet: The chief executive of Domino’s Pizza, Patrick Doyle, told CNBC that it would need to raise its base pay to get the “right people” and to stay competitive.
abstract: Domino's Pizza chief executive Patrick Doyle tells CNBC that company will have to raise its base pay to remain competitive with other, similar companies; higher wages will only affect employees at restaurants owned by the company, not those at franchises.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Domino’s Pizza, Patrick Doyle, told CNBC that it would need to raise its base pay to get the “right people” and to stay competitive.

headline.main: Domino’s Chief Says Pizza Chain Must Raise Its Base Wage
headline.print_headline: C.E.O. Says Domino’s Pizza Must Raise Its Base Wage
